intro: Euphrasia collina subsp. collina, commonly known as the cliff-fringed eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found growing on cliffs or slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are usually yellow or yellow-green with prominent dark veins. It is valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
